thread.title: Guy Williams sorry for dropping f-bomb on live TV
thread.title_full: Guy Williams sorry for dropping f-bomb on live TV

title: Guy Williams sorry for dropping f-bomb on live TV
text:
Guy Williams sorry for dropping f-bomb on live TV Last updated 23:11, February 23 2017 LAWRENCE SMITH / FAIRFAX NZ 
Guy Williams thanked viewers and apologised for dropping the f-bomb on live TV. 
Kiwi comedian Guy Williams has apologised for dropping an f-bomb during the live prime time premiere of Jono and Ben. 
The f-word on live television marked the first episode of the show's sixth season. 
William's apologised on Twitter and thanked viewers who tuned in. 
Jono and Ben are back and they're live. 
"Thanks to everyone who watched! Sorry about the f bomb! Won't happen again," he posted after the show. Thanks to everyone who watched! Sorry about the f bomb! Won't happen again. #JonoandBen â€” Guy Williams (@guywilliamsguy) February 23, 2017 
Thursday night's episode was not available to view on the ThreeNow website.
